revised_title: Evolution of Drug Resistance in Bacteria: Folic Acid Derivatives and Sulphathiazole Resistance
tldr: This study investigates the evolution of drug resistance in bacteria, specifically focusing on the relationship between folic acid derivatives and sulphathiazole resistance in Escherichia coli. The authors found that bacteria with resistance to sulphathiazole have an enhanced ability to synthesize folic acid and accumulate intracellular pteridine. This resistance can be inherited and is associated with altered enzymatic activities and alternative metabolic pathways.
